questions.question_text: An engineer must enable video desktop sharing between a Cisco Unified Communications Manager registered video endpoint and a Cisco VCS registered video endpoint. Which protocol must be enabled in SIP profile for VCS SIP trunk on Cisco Unified Communications Manager?

discussion.content:
The correct answer is BFCP.
Sip Profile checkbox 
Allow Presentation Sharing using BFCP 
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/telepresence/infrastructure/vcs/config_guide/X8-7/Cisco-VCS-SIP-Trunk-to-Unified-CM-Deployment-Guide-CUCM-8-9-10-11-and-X8-7.pdf

questions.question_text:
An engineer is configuring a SIP profile for Cisco VCS SIP trunk on Cisco Unified Communications Manager and enables the option "Use Fully Qualified Domain
Name" in SIP Requests. Which result is achieved by enabling this option?

choices.B: Resolve FQDN using DNS type A record.
choices.D: Ensure FQDN is used in SIP Request header.
choices.A: Resolve FQDN using DNS type SRV record.
choices.C: Ensure FQDN is used in SIP Identity header.

choices.A: Resolve names outside of the direct control of the Cisco VCS that exist on the public Internet.
choices.B: Connect to another Cisco VCS on the same side of the firewall to extend dialing capabilities.
choices.C: Traverse a firewall from a protected network to a public or DMZ network.
choices.E: Manage bandwidth to restrict standard definition endpoints from using more than 2 Mb of bandwidth.
choices.D: Apply registration, authentication, and media encryption policies.

questions.question_text: Which two options are functionalities of subzones in a Cisco VCS deployment? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The answer is correct 
If an H.323 or a non-encrypted connection is also required, a separate pair of traversal zones must be
configured.

This means that remote workers can now register to the VCS Expressway (assuming it has its SIP
registration proxy mode set to Off) and be authenticated securely via the VCS Control against an
authentication mechanism inside the enterprise.

choices.B: One Cisco Unified Communications traversal zone for H.323 and SIP connections.
choices.C: A separate pair of traversal zones must be configured if an H.323 connection is required and Interworking is disabled.
choices.E: Create a set of username and password on each of the Expressway-C and Expressway-E to authenticate the neighboring peer.
choices.D: Enable username and password authentication verification on Expressway-E.
choices.A: Expressway-C and Expressway-E must trust each other's server certificate.

questions.question_text: Which two options should be used to create a secure traversal zone between the Expressway-C and Expressway-E? (Choose two.)

A presales engineer is working on a quote for a major customer and must evaluate how many Cisco VCS Expressway traversal call licenses for which to plan.
Calls to and from which three routes must the engineer include in the tally? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Right answer is CDF.
Traversal clients include other VCSs, gatekeepers, Border Controllers, or traversal-enabled endpoints.
From https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/telepresence-video-communication-server-vcs/118872-technote-vcs-00.html
